name: Mum's Aussie Sausage Rolls
author: eaperry
summary: My mother grew up in Australia and made these for me all the time. They are certainly the most delicious sausage rolls you will ever eat!
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package roll sausage (such as Jimmy Dean®)
2 tablespoons warm water, or more as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
Mix sausage, bread crumbs, onion, paprika, and garlic powder together in a bowl
Tear bread slices into pieces and place in a bowl; add 2 tablespoon warm water to moisten
Add to sausage mixture; stir until well combined
Unfold puff pastry sheet; roll out to to a 12x16-inch rectangle
Cut the sheet lengthwise into 3 equal sections
Mix egg yolk with 1 tablespoon water and glaze the edges of the pastry
Divide sausage mixture into 3 equal portions
Spread 1 portion down the middle of each pastry strip
Roll pastry edges up and pinch together, forming 3 long pastry-covered sausages
Turn rolls over and glaze with egg mixture
Slice each roll into 1 1/4-inch pieces; arrange on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes
